magpie.models.regression

Class StagedRegression

  • java.lang.Object
    • magpie.models.BaseModel
      • magpie.models.regression.BaseRegression
        • magpie.models.regression.StagedRegression
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, MultiModel, AbstractRegressionModel, Citable, Commandable, Options, Printable, Savable

    public class StagedRegression
extends BaseRegression
implements MultiModel, AbstractRegressionModel
    Composite regression where the error signal from a model is used to train the next.

    Usage: <absolute|relative>
    absolute|relative: Whether to train model on absolute or relative error

    Implemented Commands:

    submodel - Print the number of submodels

    submodel set generic $<model> - Define a model template to use for all submodels
    model: An instance of BaseModel. Note: Do not use this command for CompositeRegression unless each model automatically uses a different random number seed. Otherwise, each submodel will be identical.

    submodel set <number> $<model> - Set a specific submodel
    number: Index of the submodel to set (list starts with 0)
    model: An instance of BaseModel to use for that model

    <output> = submodel get generic - Retrieve the template for any unassigned submodels

    <output> = submodel get <number> - Retrieve a specific submodel
    number: Index of submodel to retrieve (list starts with 0) Returns a clone of the model - you cannot use this to edit the model.

    Implemented Print Commands

    submodel - Print out number of submodels

    submodel <number> [<command...>] - Pass a print command to one of the submodels
    number: Index of model to operate on (starts at 0)
    command: Print command that gets passed to that submodel

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • printModelDescriptionDetails

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> printModelDescriptionDetails(boolean htmlFormat)
        Description copied from class: BaseModel
        Print details of the model. Used by BaseModel.printDescription(boolean).

        Implementation note: No not add indentation for details. That is handled by BaseModel.printDescription(boolean). You should also call the super operation to get the Normalizer and Attribute selector settings

        Overrides:
        printModelDescriptionDetails in class BaseModel
        Parameters:
        htmlFormat - Whether to use HTML format
        Returns:
        List describing model details. Each entry is a different line of the description (i.e., in place of newline characters).
